title: Downloadable Linux test bundle packaging + docs (frontend-only)

requirements.summary: Add a Linux packaging script that produces a single archive containing built frontend assets plus a single-command launcher script for local testing.
acceptanceCriteria: A new packaging script exists in the repo (e.g., under a scripts/ directory) that produces a single distributable archive (e.g., .tar.gz) when run on Linux.

The distributable archive contains: (1) the built frontend assets, (2) the compiled canister artifacts needed for local deployment, and (3) a run script (e.g., run.sh) that starts a local replica (if needed) and deploys/serves the app for testing.
Running the included run script on Linux results in the app being accessible for testing (e.g., via a local URL) without requiring the user to manually execute multiple setup commands.

file_operations.description: Create a Linux-only packaging script that (a) builds the frontend, (b) gathers required local testing artifacts produced by the repo’s existing IC tooling, and (c) emits a single .tar.gz containing the built frontend output, required IC local artifacts, and the launcher script. Ensure the script also copies any required docs/scripts into the archive and prints the output archive location.

Create the launcher script intended to be included inside the distributable archive as run.sh. Script should start/prepare the local environment using the repo’s existing IC tooling, deploy the app for local testing, and print the local URL/port for access; include stop/reset guidance output as needed.

requirements.summary: Add Linux testing documentation for downloading, prerequisites, running the launcher script, and troubleshooting.
acceptanceCriteria: A new documentation page is added (or an existing doc is extended) describing: required dependencies (e.g., DFX, Node/npm if applicable), how to run the packaged bundle, expected output (URL/ports), and how to stop/reset the local environment.
Documentation is written in English and includes copy-pasteable commands for typical Linux shells (bash).

file_operations.description: Add English Linux documentation describing prerequisites, how to generate the archive with the packaging script, how to download/extract/run the included run.sh in bash, expected URL/ports, and how to stop/reset/troubleshoot common issues (dfx not found, ports in use, stale local state, permissions).

requirements.summary: Ensure the Linux bundle includes existing Raspberry Pi helper scripts and their documentation and references their paths from within the extracted bundle.
acceptanceCriteria: The distributable archive includes the existing Raspberry Pi scripts (frontend/scripts/rpi_event_runner.sh and frontend/scripts/rpi_pin_test.sh) and the related documentation (frontend/docs/rpi-bash-runner.md).
The included documentation in the bundle clearly points to the included scripts’ paths and how to execute them from the extracted directory.

file_operations.description: Update the packaging script to explicitly include frontend/scripts/rpi_event_runner.sh, frontend/scripts/rpi_pin_test.sh, and frontend/docs/rpi-bash-runner.md in the generated archive under predictable paths, and ensure file modes preserve executability for the .sh scripts.

Extend the Raspberry Pi runner documentation to include a short section for users running from the extracted Linux bundle, explicitly referencing the included script paths (as laid out by the bundle) and copy-pasteable bash commands to execute them.

Add a section that points to the included Raspberry Pi helper scripts and rpi-bash-runner.md inside the extracted bundle, including copy-pasteable bash commands to run rpi_pin_test.sh and rpi_event_runner.sh.
